API Reference version v2

https://api.pubpub.org

Introduction

This API provides access to the PubPub database. All requests and responses are in the form of application/json. Requests should be made to the following URL paths added to the hostname https://api-v2-dev.pubpub.org. For example https://api-v2-dev.pubpub.org/user?username=test1.

Authentication

Access to secured URLs is granted by one of two methods:

  1. A session cookie in the request headers
  2. Basic Auth

The cookie method is used when interacting with the database through a (often proxied) frontend. For API requests made from scripts or bots, it is best to use Basic Auth. To test basic auth, simple URL encoding is sufficient, e.g. https://[username]:[accessToken]@api-v2-dev.pubpub.org/user?username=test1

The accessToken for each user can be found on the settings page their profile (https://v3-dev.pubpub.org/user/test1/settings).

For most secured routes, authentication is optional. If authenticated, private data will be returned, but if not, any publicly available data is sent. For example, the public query for a user will return their name, image, and basic profile contents. An authenticated query for a user will return that user's email and other secured fields.

Contributing

This API documentation and the associated server code is all open source: https://github.com/pubpub/pubpub-api. Contributions, fixes, bug reports are welcome!

Example - Adding a Pub

A common use case is that you have an account, and you'd like to programatically add pubs to PubPub. There are a few simple steps to achieve this.

  1. Create pub

    The first step is to create a pub. A Pub can be thought of as a bucket for all of the content you wish to eventually publish. Discussions, contributors, versions, and publication status are all 'owned' by the Pub.

    To create a pub, send a POST request to /pub (go to docs). If succesful, this will return the newly created Pub object. It is suggested you hang onto the value of pub.id as you will need it when uploading other content.

  2. Create Versions All content within a pub is versioned. To achieve this, a pub has a series of 'versions'. Each version is a unique list of files ids. New files replace old file ids, and a new version is created. In this way, all (versions of) files are maintained and a pub accesses them through the the version wrapper.

    To create a version, send a POST request to pub/versions (go to docs). In this version, an array of File objects must be included

  3. Add Contributors

  4. Publish versions

Activities

Routes to access activities data

/activities

get

If not logged in, will return a list of global activities. If logged in, will return following activities as well as global activities. Optionally, will include assets of user (pubs and journals), for building a landing page.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • range: (string)

    date (?) or count (?) of activities to grab. Allows us to paginate

  • assets: (string)

    boolean, whether to include user pubs and journals

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  activities: {
    pubs: [],
    journals: [],
    users: [],
    labels: [],
    myPubs: [],
    myJournals: [],
    myUser: []
  }
  assets: {
    pubs: [],
    journals: [],
  },
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Activities not found

Follows

Routes to access data about a followers

/follows/label

Routes to access data about a Label's followers

get

Get a list of all followers

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • labelId: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
      "id": 1,
      "username": "jane-doe",
      "firstName": "Jane",
      "lastName": "Doe",
      "image": "http://images.com/example.jpg"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Label not found
post

Create a new Follow

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the label that will be followed.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  "followerId": 1,
  "labelId": 3,
  "updatedAt": "2016-11-22T02:10:21.874Z",
  "createdAt": "2016-11-22T02:10:21.874Z",
  "notifyOnNewVersion": null,
  "notifyOnNewFeature": null,
  "notifyOnNewDiscussions": null
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error following label"
}
put

edit the values of the follow

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the label that will have follow data updated.

  • notifyOnNewVersion: (string)

    whether notifications are created for new versions.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error updated Follow"
}
delete

Remove a follow

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the label to remove follow from

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting follow"
}

Journal

Routes to access data about Journals

/journal

get
  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • slug: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true
post

Create a new Journal

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • name: required (string)

    name used for the new journal

  • slug: required (string)

    slug used for the journal url

  • short description: required (string)

    short description used for the new journal

  • longDescription: (string)

    long description to be used for the new journal

  • logo: (string)

    Large log for the new journal. Can be used in the header of the journal's page

  • icon: (string)

    square icon for the new journal. Used on preview cards

  • website: (string)

    website url

  • twitter: (string)

    twitter account

  • facebook: (string)

    facebook account

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
    "slug": "my-journal",
    "title": "My Journal",
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating journal"
}
put

Used to allow a journal admin to update the journal.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal to be changed

  • slug: (string)

    new slug

  • name: (string)

    new title

  • shortDescription: (string)

    new shortDescription

  • longDescription: (string)

    new longDescription

  • logo: (string)

    new logo

  • icon: (string)

    new icon

  • website: (string)

    new website

  • twitter: (string)

    new twitter

  • facebook: (string)

    new facebook

  • headerColor: (string)

    new headerColor

  • headerMode: (string)

    new headerMode

  • headerAlign: (string)

    new headerAlign

  • headerImage: (string)

    new headerImage

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error updating journal"
}
delete

Delete the journal

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • journal: (string)

    id of the journal to be deleted

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Journal set inactive

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting journal"
}

/journal/labels

Routes to access data about the labels (collections) owned by a journal, and to apply them to pubs.

get

Get labels (collections) associated with a given journal.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • journalId: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    id: 9,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Journal not found
post

Create a PubLabel. The relation between a pub and a label

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (string)

    id of the pub the label is being applied to

  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the label to be applied

  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal owning the label

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating PubLabel for this journal"
}
delete

Delete the label relationship

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (string)

    id of the pub the label is being applied to

  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the label to be applied

  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal owning the label

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Pub set inactive

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting pub"
}

  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters

  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal this admin is being added to

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  "id": 5,
  "createdAt": "2016-11-21T21:08:06.824Z",
  "updatedAt": "2016-11-21T21:08:06.824Z",
  "userId": 2,
  "journalId": 1,
  "user": {
    "id": 2,
    "username": "test-account",
    "firstName": "Test",
    "lastName": "Account",
    "image": "http://image.com/example.jpg"
  }
}

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating new contributor"
}

Body

Type: application/json

Body

Type: application/json

Type: application/json

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    id: 9,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Journal not found
put

Change the isRejected value of a pubSubmit

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (string)

    id of the pub to be updated

  • journalId: required (string)

    id of the journal

  • isRejected: (string)

    BOOLEAN dictating whether the submission has been rejected

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating pub"
}

Labels

Routes to access data about labels

/labels

get

Get specific label and associated pubs.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • title: (string)

    title of the label

  • pubId: (string)

    id of the pub owning a label

  • userId: (string)

    id of the user owning a label

  • journalId: (string)

    id of the journal owning a label

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
      "id": 1,
      "title": "Biology",
      "color": null
  },
  {
      "id": 2,
      "title": "Physics",
      "color": "#335529"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Pub not found
post

Create a Label. Currently, labels can only be created if associated with a journal, user, of pub.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • userId: (string)

    id of the user the label is owned by

  • pubId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • journalId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • title: required (string)

    title of the label

  • color: (string)

    color of the label

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  id: 5,
  userId: 4,
  title: "My Physics Label",
  color: "#ff0000",
  updatedAt: "2016-11-30T21:50:45.124Z",
  createdAt: "2016-11-30T21:50:45.124Z",
  journalId: null,
  pubId: null
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating label"
}
put

Update a Label. Currently, labels can only be updated if associated with a journal, user, of pub.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • userId: (string)

    id of the user the label is owned by

  • pubId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • journalId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the label to be updated

  • title: (string)

    title of the updated label

  • color: (string)

    color of the updated label

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating pub"
}
delete

Delete the label

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • userId: (string)

    id of the user the label is owned by

  • pubId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • journalId: (string)

    id of the pub the label is owned by

  • labelId: required (string)

    id of the pub the label is being applied to

Licenses

Routes to access licenses available on PubPub

/licenses

get

Return array of all licenses, or, if licenseId is provided, return an array with a single specific license

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • licenseId: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "title": "CC BY 3.0 US",
  "description": "Share — copy and redistribute the material in any medium or format\nAdapt — remix, transform, and build upon the material\nfor any purpose, even commercially.\nThe licensor cannot revoke these freedoms as long as you follow the license terms.",
  "url": "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/us/",
  "image": "https://creativecommons.org/images/deed/by.png"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Licenses found

Login

Used to login a user

/login

get

Gets the associated signup data for a given hash. Most importantly, returns the email that was signed up with.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • hash: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  image: "https://images.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane"
}

HTTP status code 401

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Unauthorized
post

Creates a signup hash for a given email address. If the email has already been used (and account creation has not been completed), it will increment the count. On creation or increment, a signup email is sent.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • email: required (string)

    email of the account to login

  • password: required (string)

    password of the account to login

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  image: "https://images.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane"
}

HTTP status code 401

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Unauthorized

Logout

Used to logout the user associated with cookies

/logout

get

Logout the given user based on their cookie

  • Response

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

Pub

Routes to access data about Pubs

/pub

get

Get pub data. Includes connected user, discussion, label, etc data. If the user's cookie or token is included, private data (private discussions, versions, etc) are included.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • slug: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    id: 9,
    slug: "pub-slug",
    title: "My Great Document",
    description: "A description about this document",
    previewImage: "https://www.image.com/myimage",
    isReply: null,
    isClosed: null,
    hideAuthorsList: null,
    customAuthorList: null,
    distinguishedClone: null,

  • Response

Form Parameters

    pub which owns the given contributor to be edited

  • contributorId: required (string)

    id of the contributor to be updated

  • canEdit: (string)

    whether this contributor can edit this pub

  • canRead: (string)

    whether this contributor can read private content in this pub

  • isAuthor: (string)

    whether this contributor is listed as an author

  • isHidden: (string)

    whether this contributor is hidden from public display

    message for this given version

  • isPublished: required (string)

    Boolean for whether this version should be published

  • files: (string)

    All files, those that are new should NOT include an "id" field and they will be added.

  • defaultFile: (string)

    Default file for this version

  • newFileAttribution: (string)

    Array of objects with {source: [file.name], destination: [file.name]}.

  • newFileRelations: (string)

    Array of objects with {fileName: [file.name], userId: [user's id]}.

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
    "id": 15,
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating pub"
}
put

Set the isPublished value of a version to TRUE

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: required (string)

    id of the pub to be changed

  • versionId: required (string)

    id of the version to be changed

  • doi: (string)

    new DOI for a given version

  • defaultFile: (string)

    new defautlFile for a given version

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error updating pub"
}
delete

Delete the pub

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • pubId: (string)

    id of the pub to be deleted

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Pub set inactive

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error deleting pub"
}

Search

Routes to access PubPub search features

/search/all

get

Search for pubs, users, journals, and labels by string.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  pubs: [],
  users: [],
  journals: [],
  labels: []
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Labels found

/search/journal

get

Search for journals by string. Journal name, url, and short description are indexed.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Journal of physics",
  "slug": "physics",
  "shortDescription": "This journal is about physics and other interesting things.",
  "logo": "http://www.image.com/example.jpg",
  "icon": "http://www.image.com/icon.jpg",
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Journals found

/search/label

get

Search for labels by string. Label title is indexed.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "title": "Biology"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Labels found

/search/pub

get

Search for pubs by string. Pub title, url, and short description are indexed.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "title": "Exciting new study!",
  "slug": "exciting",
  "description": "Here is my description",
  "previewImage": "http://www.image.com/example.jpg",
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Pubs found

/search/user

get

Search for users by string. First name, last name, and username are indexed.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • q: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

[
  {
  "id": 1,
  "username": "travis",
  "firstName": "Test",
  "lastName": "LastName",
  "image": "https://assets.pubpub.org/lzflunkd/1479834370629.jpg"
  }
]

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

No Users found

SignUp

Used to trigger a signup request for a given email.

/signup

get

Gets the associated signup data for a given hash. Most importantly, returns the email that was signed up with.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • hash: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  hash: "hfwk18jJGTE81maj12K0kal9BY",
  email: "email@example.com"
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Hash not valid
post

Creates a signup hash for a given email address. If the email has already been used (and account creation has not been completed), it will increment the count. On creation or increment, a signup email is sent.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • email: required (string)

    email of the account to be created

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

true

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Email already tied to an account

User

Routes to access data about Users

/user

get

Get the data for a user's profile. This includes associated pubs, forks, journals, etc. Private pubs, private data included if authenticated.

  • Request
  • Response

Query Parameters

  • username: required (string)

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  image: "https://images.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com (if authenticated)"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane",
  journals: [],
  pubs: [],
  followers: [],
  following: [],

}

HTTP status code 404

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "User not found"
}
post

Create a new User

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • email: required (string)

    email used in SignUp

  • hash: required (string)

    hash generated by SignUp. Used to validate account creation

  • username: required (string)

    username of the new User to be created

  • firstName: required (string)

    first name of the new User to be created

  • lastName: required (string)

    first name of the new User to be created

  • image: required (string)

    image for the new User to be created

  • password: required (string)

    a hash of the users typed password

  • bio: (string)

    bio for the new User to be created

  • publicEmail: (string)

    email that will be publicly displayed for the new User to be created

  • github: (string)

    github for the new User to be created

  • orcid: (string)

    orcid for the new User to be created

  • twitter: (string)

    twitter for the new User to be created

  • website: (string)

    website for the new User to be created

  • googleScholar: (string)

    googleScholar for the new User to be created

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  image: "https://images.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane"
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error creating user"
}
put

Update the user with the given username

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • userId: required (string)

    id of the user to be updated

  • email: (string)

    email for user

  • firstName: (string)

    first name of the User

  • lastName: (string)

    first name of the User

  • image: (string)

    image for the User

  • bio: (string)

    bio for the User

  • publicEmail: (string)

    email that will be publicly displayed for the User

  • github: (string)

    github for the User

  • orcid: (string)

    orcid for the User

  • twitter: (string)

    twitter for the User

  • website: (string)

    website for the User

  • googleScholar: (string)

    googleScholar for the User

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  username: "jane"
  firstName: "Jane"
  lastName: "Sanchez"
  image: "https://images.com/1234"
  email: "jane@email.com"
  bio: "I am a biologist."
  publicEmail: "jane@public.com"
  github: "https://github.com/jane"
  orcid: "123-412-1234-123"
  twitter: "@jane"
  website: "https://www.jane.com"
  googleScholar: "janejane"
}

HTTP status code 500

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
  error : "Error updating user"
}

  • Response

/user/password

Used to reset a users password

post

Reset a users password.

  • Request
  • Response

Body

Type: application/json

Form Parameters
  • username: required (string)

    username of the account to login

  • password: required (string)

    password after hashing

  • resetHash: (string)

    The reset password hash you were granted by PubPub. If not logged in, must have a hash

HTTP status code 200

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

{
}

HTTP status code 401

Body

Type: application/json

Example:

Unauthorized
